name: Permafrost Degradation / Thermokarst
functionStatement: Balanced sediment supply and transport preserves bed elevations, substrate sizes, and habitat quality while supporting riparian succession.
descriptionMarkdown: Permafrost condition and evidence of thaw/degradation within the contributing area, which can increase sediment and alter hydrology.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel

Method: Desktop (GIS/imagery) with field verification where feasible
howToMeasureMarkdown: Review permafrost maps and recent imagery for evidence of thaw slumps/thermokarst and evaluate per the metric definition; confirm in field where feasible. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.

inputs.label: Permafrost Degradation / Thermokarst
inputs.type: desktop (gis/imagery) with field verification where feasible

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: No areas of permafrost degradation in the catchment area have been observed. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Areas of permafrost degradation exist within or upstream of the project reach contributing to hillslope slumping or increased erosion but are not resulting in impacts to water quality. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Areas of permafrost degradation exist within or upstream of the project reach contributing to hillslope slumping or increased erosion but are not resulting in impacts to water quality. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Areas of permafrost degradation exist within or upstream of the project reach, contributing to hillslope slumping, increased erosion, and/or water quality impacts. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

bin1.name: Poor
bin1.desc: Areas of permafrost degradation exist within or upstream of the project reach, contributing to hillslope slumping, increased erosion, and/or water quality impacts.

bin2.name: Fair
bin2.desc: Areas of permafrost degradation exist within or upstream of the project reach contributing to hillslope slumping or increased erosion but are not resulting in impacts to water quality.

bin3.name: Good
bin3.desc: No areas of permafrost degradation in the catchment area have been observed.
